title: 115_hr2185
content: The "Iran Sanctions Relief Review Act" may be cited as the short title. It involves determining if foreign financial institutions have facilitated transactions for covered persons. The "Iran Sanctions Relief Review Act" requires the President to assess foreign financial institutions' involvement in significant transactions for covered persons every 180 days for up to 5 years. Certifications must be submitted to congressional committees in unclassified form, with the possibility of a classified annex. Significant financial services are determined based on section 561.404 of title 31, Code of Federal Regulations. The President must determine if certain foreign persons have supported designated individuals every 180 days for up to 5 years. The determination must be transmitted to congressional committees. The information must be submitted in unclassified form, with the possibility of a classified annex. A person described in this section is an organization designated as a foreign terrorist organization by the Secretary of State or a foreign person whose property is blocked under various Executive Orders related to terrorism and weapons of mass destruction proliferation. Executive Orders related to blocking property and prohibiting transactions with Syria include Executive Orders 13399, 13460, 13572, 13573, and 13582.
